intro: Sphaeranthus fischeri, commonly known as the Fischer's globe flower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows from a succulent, branched stem and has small, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. It is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to harsh, dry environments. Sphaeranthus fischeri is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
